item.title: Donald Trump's America-first policies are pushing countries into China's embrace
item.description: Inside China, there's a nickname for Donald Trump that tells you everything you need to know about how the US leader's actions are increasingly seen as a gift to Beijing.

item.title: Rockhampton residents urged to avoid floodwaters as Fitzroy River approaches peak
item.description: Police warn central Queensland residents against entering floodwaters, after several social media posts showed people in the shallows of a swollen river.

item.title: Crime gangs restocking shops 'up to 10 times a day' with illegal cigarettes and vapes, WA police say
item.description: WA's police commissioner says the restocking is happening faster than authorities can seize the products, as tobacco black market violence escalates.

item.title: American rider and brumby complete 4,400km journey across Australia
item.description: Gin Szagola and her brumby, Fable, have completed a coast-to-coast journey, covering 4,400 kilometres in eight months.

item.title: Alice Springs Mayor Asta Hill will not attend Australia Day ceremony
item.description: Asta Hill will not take part in celebrations of Australia Day, which she sees as a day causing harm to First Nations peoples — a decision described as "disgraceful" by the local member of the Northern Territory Legislative Assembly.

item.title: WA premier Roger Cook extends embattled Griffin Coal's lifeline, citing energy security concerns
item.description: Since 2022, the WA government has already tipped $300 million into propping up the insolvent Indian-owned miner, which is more than $1 billion in debt.

item.title: Canadian PM says smaller nations must 'band together' to stop larger countries overpowering them
item.description: Canadian PM Mark Carney told the World Economic Forum "middle powers must act together".

item.title: Chun Lai Yuen jailed after teenager Caitlyn Dickson seriously injured in Burswood crash
item.description: The driver of a speeding car which hit and seriously injured a teenage girl after a car club meet-up at the Burswood Casino precinct has been sent to prison.

item.title: NZ Prime Minister Christopher Luxon calls for election on November 7
item.description: NZ's Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has announced the election date for 2026, promising economic prosperity if New Zealanders vote for him again.

item.title: Liberals 'not that stressed' by leak — but Labor seizes on attempt to 'destabilise' leader
item.description: The leaking of an SA Liberal document two months before the state election has been described by the Labor government as a "calculated and methodical" attempt to "destabilise" new leader Ashton Hurn — but her party says it is "not that stressed" because the policy is old.

item.title: What we know about changing UK passport requirements effective February 25
item.description: Hundreds of confused UK and Irish dual citizens in Australia have written to the ABC with questions around the new changes for entry requirements into the UK. Here's what we know.

item.title: Australian NATO envoy Di Turton warns North Korea has 'combat-ready troops in our region'
item.description: Australia's outgoing military envoy to NATO is preparing to return to Canberra after two years in the role, and she is coming home with a warning.

item.title: Man who assassinated Shinzo Abe sentenced to life in prison by Japanese court
item.description: Tetsuya Yamagami pleaded guilty to fatally shooting Mr Abe as he stood surrounded by security, media and supporters in 2022.

item.title: Why Elina Svitolina is prioritising her mental health at the Australian Open
item.description: In the highly competitive world of professional tennis, it is refreshing to learn that Elina Svitolina has her priorities in order.

item.title: New South Wales man charged with allegedly threatening prime minister
item.description: A NSW Mid North Coast man is granted bail after he allegedly threatened to shoot the prime minister, in a video uploaded to social media.

item.title: Midnight Oil's Rob Hirst died of pancreatic cancer. It's one of Australia's deadliest
item.description: Rob Hirst was first diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in 2023. It is estimated to be the third most common cause of cancer death in Australia, and has among the lowest survival rates.

item.title: Have you been gifted an ancestry DNA test? The results could be 'life-altering'
item.description: If you're thinking of taking an ancestry DNA test as "a bit of fun", experts warn there is the risk of uncovering more than you bargained for.

item.title: Police probe possible link between Pilates studio fires and alleged arson attack
item.description: Police investigate fires at two NSW Central Coast Pilates studios, one of which was destroyed by fire less than a year ago.

item.title: Police believe Mandurah teacher's baby fathered by student she allegedly sexually abused
item.description: Police believe a Mandurah teacher gave birth to a baby fathered by a student she allegedly sexually assaulted.

item.title: New hate laws have passed parliament. What do they actually do?
item.description: The new laws grant powers for the government to list so-called hate groups, more easily deport or cancel the visas of individuals associated with hate groups and create new aggravated penalties for leaders who advocate violence.

item.title: Donald Trump's second presidency is about 'might makes right' and reshaping the world order be it in Venezuela or Greenland
item.description: As Donald Trump celebrates one year of his second term in the White House, he is rewriting all the rules for global order, and no-one seems ready to stop his "imperial ambitions".

item.title: WA gold companies 'floating on a sea of cash' as the commodity hits new price record
item.description: A Kalgoorlie miner hopes the soaring price of gold will incentivise investment into regional WA.

item.title: Why Emmanuel Macron was wearing sunglasses at Davos World Economic Forum
item.description: The French president's appearance at the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum makes headlines, but not for any policy reasons.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Banned Adelaide doctor Bill Tolis in court over steroid importation charges
item.description: A man who was banned from working as a doctor in 2022 appears in court charged with importing steroids and peptides that the Australian Border Force allegedly found in a medical clinic and at his home.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu, Azerbaijan agree to join Trump's 'Board of Peace' as Norway and Sweden reject invitations
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to join US President Donald Trump's "Board of Peace" despite his office previously criticising the makeup of the executive committee.

item.title: Father of Adelaide girl who died due to mother's alleged neglect tells court of coffin threat
item.description: The father of a 15-year-old girl whose mother is accused of her manslaughter, tells the South Australian Supreme Court of a threat made against his daughter and punishment she was made to do.

item.title: Why have there been so many shark attacks in NSW lately?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Coalition on the brink as Nationals quit shadow ministry
item.description: Opposition leader Sussan Ley says the Nationals' mass resignation from her frontbench is "unnecessary" and has urged the rural party to remain in the Coalition.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners raise dingo management issues after teen's death
item.description: The body of Piper James, 19, was found surrounded by dingoes on a beach on the island's eastern coast, but how she died may not be known for some time.

item.title: Donald Trump drops Greenland tariffs threat as he heralds 'future deal' with NATO
item.description: Donald Trump says he has agreed to a "framework of a future deal" on Greenland after talks with NATO's secretary-general, and he will no longer impose tariffs on European nations that had opposed a US takeover.

item.title: Japan restarts nuclear power plant almost 15 years since Fukushima disaster
item.description: The world's biggest nuclear power plant has been rebooted by the same company that operated the Fukushima facility, despite concerns about safety from some locals.

item.title: Why Ukrainians are shivering through their fourth winter in wartime
item.description: The war-ravaged country has been plunged into an energy crisis as temperatures plummet below freezing, leaving millions unable to heat their homes.

item.title: Royal Hobart Hospital medical scan backlog creating late diagnosis risk, AMA says
item.description: The Royal Hobart Hospital is facing a significant backlog of medical scans, with at least one patient experiencing a late diagnosis. The AMA and a union say it's a sign of a system facing a range of pressures.

item.title: Students have their say in disaster planning in Melbourne's bushfire-prone outer east
item.description: In a bushfire-prone area in outer Melbourne, a group of students is taking part in a two-way learning exchange to improve bushfire safety.

item.title: How closely have you been following the 2026 awards season?
item.description: Fancy yourself an awards season whiz? Test your knowledge as we rocket towards the 2026 Academy awards.

item.title: Republicans push to hold Clintons in contempt of Congress over Epstein probe
item.description: The Clintons are refusing to testify before a committee in the US House of Representatives, accusing Republicans of leading a weaponised process against them.

item.title: Calls to bring back hard-hitting anti-smoking campaigns to warn off gen Z
item.description: Experts say Australia risks becoming complacent in the war against tobacco, with big companies pivoting to social media to "greenwash" their products to generation Z.

item.title: Nationals' walkout leaves Coalition in tatters
item.description: The departure of every single member of the Nationals from the frontbench is bizarrely both a failure of the Coalition agreement and a result of it functioning as intended.

item.title: Australia earns global praise for economic 'soft landing' but still dependent on China
item.description: A new report from the OECD says Australia's economy is returning to normal but remains vulnerable and lacks dynamism.

item.title: Europe holds the trump card as the US faces a mountain of debt
item.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

item.title: The shark mitigation measures in place at NSW beaches
item.description: Shark mitigation measures have come a long way since the first nets were rolled out in Sydney almost 90 years ago.

item.title: 'Ten-pound Pom' vows to boycott UK over 'money grab' passport changes
item.description: People who came to Australia as children from the UK as part of an organised migration scheme say they the UK's new regulations for dual citizens unfairly targets them.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes beat Melbourne Stars in rainy thriller to keep BBL title defence alive
item.description: The Hobart Hurricanes hold their nerve to beat the Melbourne Stars in a rain-shortened Big Bash elimination final.

item.title: Taskforce set up to address ongoing power outages across SA from dust pollution
item.description: Ongoing dry conditions across South Australia since 2024 are causing dust and salt to build up across inland and coastal power networks, polluting insulators and leading to mass blackouts.

item.title: Trump rules out using force to acquire Greenland
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Back-to-school budgeting a chance for kids to learn financial literacy and empathy
item.description: Managing back-to-school costs, especially when kids want expensive brand name items, can cause a lot of stress for families. But including children in the budgeting and decision-making process is key to helping everyone get on the same page.

item.title: Manchester City players reimburse travelling fans after shock Champions League loss to Bodo/Glimt
item.description: Manchester City players combine to pay back the cost of match tickets to fans who travelled to freezing Norway for a shock Champions League defeat to Bodø/Glimt.

item.title: Former and current presenters share 50 years of memories at ABC Classic
item.description: From late-life love stories to musical discoveries, presenters reveal what has made ABC Classic special for audiences for 50 years.

item.title: More than one disaster a week raises concerns over mental health support
item.description: Mental health experts warn of significant barriers to support in disaster-affected communities, as Australia records more than one natural disaster a week since January 2025.

item.title: $10 billion data centre planned for Hazelwood in Victoria's Latrobe Valley
item.description: Victoria's east is set to become home to a $10 billion data centre that will support the technology necessary for artificial intelligence systems.

item.title: Police arrest 15-year-old boy over alleged antisemitism incident in St Kilda
item.description: Detectives investigating an alleged antisemitism incident in St Kilda this week have arrested a 15-year-old boy.

item.title: Concerns raised after sawfish, sharks and turtle found mutilated on northwest WA beaches
item.description: Residents and experts say they are shocked and concerned after social media images showed a number of endangered and protected marine animals impaled and severed on a stretch of WA coastline in just a few weeks.

item.title: Plan to rebuild world's largest living coral aquarium explained after years of delays
item.description: The world's largest living coral reef exhibit is yet to be rebuilt five years after the Queensland aquarium closed.

item.title: Tour website's AI sends visitors to Tasmanian sites that do not exist
item.description: Weldborough in remote north-east Tasmania has lots of natural beauty. But it does not have hot springs — and it is causing headaches for locals.

item.title: Administrators seek buyers for Sanjeev Gupta's Tahmoor Coal mine
item.description: Administrators have put Sanjeev Gupta's Tahmoor Coal mine up for sale, seeking buyers to recover value for creditors and potentially restart operations.

item.title: Why did Queensland's flood warning gauges fail when they were needed most?
item.description: Queensland's flood emergency exposed vast holes in the patchwork of river gauges relied on for early warnings. But getting them back online will take a lot more than a reboot.

item.title: Coalition splits for second time since election after Nationals quit shadow cabinet
item.description: David Littleproud says the Nationals have been put in an "untenable" position and are not willing to serve in a shadow ministry led by Sussan Ley.

item.title: Sydney council explores offshore sand dredging as locals fear losing beaches
item.description: A group of passionate locals have called for a long-term solution to the disappearing sand from beaches in Sydney's Sutherland Shire.

item.title: Murray-Darling water-sharing study proposes combining agriculture and conservation
item.description: Can breeding birds and growing rice combine to help both conservation and agriculture in the basin?

item.title: Man bitten by shark at Manly described as 'talented musician, lover of surfing'
item.description: Andre de Ruyter is described by his family as a talented musician who loves surfing.

item.title: Several people missing after landslide hits Mount Maunganui campground in New Zealand
item.description: A landslide hits campervans, cars, tents and a toilet and shower block at the Mount Maunganui camping site in New Zealand in what has been described as a "major incident".

item.title: Unemployment rate drops to 4.1 per cent ahead of RBA's next rates meeting
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate fell from 4.3 to 4.1 per cent in December, according to seasonally adjusted figures from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: Young girl among several missing after landslide at NZ campsite — as it happened
item.description: Several people are missing after a landslide at a campsite in the tourism hotspot of Mount Maunganui, south-east of Auckland.

item.title: March for Australia administrators encouraged members to join White Australia political party
item.description: March for Australia organisers are planning a fresh round of mass demonstrations across the country on January 26, with members encouraging others to join the now disbanded White Australia Party.

item.title: The optics are diabolical for Liberals and Nationals, as chaos reigns on a supposed day of mourning
item.description: Littleproud and his team have now basically broken one of the most fundamental political rules of the Coalition — the Nationals are now effectively dictating to the Liberals who their leader should be.

item.title: In Davos, European leaders met Donald Trump with strength and he backed down
item.description: European leaders will be breathing a sigh of relief that the extraordinary threat of a US invasion of Greenland has receded. But some things cannot be undone.

item.description: Volunteers in Darwin have chipped in to capture more than 1,000 cane toads at one of the city's main attractions.

item.description: Rights groups slam Thai authorities' detention and legal proceedings against Australian writer Murray Hunter, after Malaysia's communications regulator submitted a criminal defamation complaint.

item.description: A young girl is among those missing after a landslide hit a popular campsite south-east of Auckland.

item.description: In the wake of the Coalition's divorce, there are few options for besieged Opposition Leader Sussan Ley, who must again reshuffle her cabinet and return to parliament with a diminished Opposition.

item.title: The 'Golden Dome' and why Trump wants the defence system in Greenland
item.description: Donald Trump wants a US "Golden Dome" missile defence system to be built in Greenland. This is what it involves and why some experts are skeptical of the plan.

item.title: Rockhampton escapes moderate flood level with revised river height predictions
item.description: Rockhampton was bracing for a moderate flood all week, with revised predictions now showing it will only reach a minor level. Some residents and sporting clubs will wait for days for waters to recede, to assess damage.

item.title: Woman who assaulted psychiatrist and other healthcare workers remanded
item.description: A judge tells a Victorian court the safety of healthcare workers must be protected while remanding a mentally ill woman to jail.

item.title: Perth financial advisor Anthony Paul Torre jailed for taking more than $1 million from clients
item.description: Victims of a Perth financial adviser jailed for misappropriating more than a million dollars from investors say his six-year jail term is not enough.

item.title: Temperature could reach 48 degrees in northern Victoria as state set to swelter through heatwave
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says maximum temperature records could tumble in some areas early next week — with the town of Ouyen tipped to reach 48 degrees — with heatwave conditions set to send temperatures soaring.

item.title: Canberra cardiologist speaks out over concerns the ACT health system is failing cardiac patients
item.description: Siang Yong Soh, who is a private Canberra cardiologist and former registrar at Canberra Health Services, says he feels compelled to speak up.

item.title: National Party's Coalition split timing deemed 'unbelievable' on National Day of Mourning for Bondi
item.description: The second messy break-up between the National and Liberal parties is concerning regional voters across the country, even in diehard conservative heartlands.

item.title: City of Perth probe lays bare workplace 'crisis', erosion of trust between Mayor and CEO
item.description: The City of Perth has rapidly descended into a workplace of psychological harm, according to a secret report obtained by the ABC.

item.title: From Bone Temple to Oscar hopefuls, here are January's best movies
item.description: Multiple Oscar hopefuls are finally hitting Australian shores this month, as well as the return of zombie franchise 28 Years Later.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: First LNG cargo from Santos Barossa gas project bound from Darwin to Japan
item.description: After a series of delays, Santos announces the first gas from its $5.6 billion Barossa project will be shipped from Darwin bound for Japan.

item.title: DFES says thousands of lightning strikes behind bushfires across southern WA
item.description: DFES says dry lightning and difficult weather sparked an ongoing fire emergency across southern WA, with one town still under direct threat from the flames.

item.description: With a 10-point tiebreaker to decide her Australian Open fate, Maddison Inglis knew there was only one avenue to victory.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Naomi Osaka apologises for 'disrespectful' post-match comments aimed at Sorana Cirstea after tense Australian Open exchange
item.description: Naomi Osaka walks back her aggressive retort to a tense handshake between her and second-round opponent Sorana Cirstea.

item.title: Oscars 2026: Sinners break record with nominations, Jacob Elordi and Rose Byrne receive nods
item.description: Vampire film Sinners broke the Academy Award record for nominations with 16, while Rose Byrne was recognised for If I had Legs I'd Kick You and Jacob Elordi got a nod for his role in Frankenstein.

item.title: Climate change increased the chance of intense Australian heatwave fivefold, study finds
item.description: A study by World Weather Attribution has analysed temperatures during the intense early January heatwave. It found that what was once a rare event is now happening far more often.

item.title: France seizes suspected Russian 'shadow fleet' oil tanker in Mediterranean
item.description: The move is the latest by Western allies to crack down on a so-called "shadow fleet" of tankers suspected of carrying Russian oil against international sanctions.

item.title: Zelenskyy flags trilateral Ukraine, Russia and US talks, while slamming 'lost' Europe
item.description: The Kremlin has confirmed the Ukrainian president's announcement, made at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

item.title: Questioning your relationship in the new year? You're not alone
item.description: The fresh start of a new year causes us to reassess many parts of our lives, including relationships. Knowing whether it's time to call it quits or give things more time requires reflection — and support — as our experts explain.

item.title: The Nationals split shows the foundations of right-wing politics are shifting
item.description: It is impossible to view this week’s events without the broader context of the relationship between the Liberals and the Nationals, how the electoral map is changing and what that means for right-wing politics in Australia.

item.title: Trump touts 'total access' Greenland deal as NATO asks allies to step up
item.description: The leaders of both Denmark and Greenland say they don't know what's in the deal, announced by the US president after he backed away from threats of tariffs and military force.

item.title: Australia names second-largest Winter Olympic team in history for 2026 Milan-Cortina Games
item.description: From five teenagers making their Winter Olympics debut to five-time Olympian and gold medal hopeful Scott James, Australia has named its second-largest team in history for the Milan-Cortina Games.

item.title: Anger and confusion after Australian courier Sendle collapses
item.description: The Australian company's customers feel like they have been "ghosted", while investors and shareholders are angry and confused about what happens next.

item.title: Seven-day heatwave to engulf south-east states, raising bushfire danger
item.description: South-east states are predicted to bake through a prolonged severe heatwave from Saturday onwards, which has the potential to break all-time temperature records and fuel another round of dangerous bushfires.

item.title: Police fire at 4WD vehicle allegedly driven at two officers in Dandenong
item.description: Police say officers shot at a four-wheel drive, which was allegedly driven at two officers in Dandenong on Thursday night.

item.title: Daylesford op shop may permanently close after donation causes bed bug infestation
item.description: The future of a Victorian op shop is in doubt after a worker opened a bag containing the stuff of nightmares, leading to the destruction of stock and hefty cleaning bills that may prove to be a deadly financial blow.

item.title: Six people confirmed missing in landslide at New Zealand's Mount Maunganui
item.description: Specialist officers have worked through the night with earthmoving equipment to try and find those trapped under the rubble at a popular tourist spot on New Zealand's North Island.

item.title: 'Catastrophic' fire danger forecast for eastern Eyre, Yorke Peninsula, on Saturday
item.description: Catastrophic fire conditions are forecast for both the Yorke Peninsula and the eastern Eyre Peninsula for Saturday, while Adelaide is forecast to have its hottest Australia Day on record and its hottest day since 2019.

item.title: David Speirs not entitled to public campaign funding, electoral commission says
item.description: Former opposition leader David Speirs would "not fulfil the nomination requirements" if he applied to be a candidate at the upcoming state election, the state's electoral commission says, raising significant doubts about his chances of a political comeback.

item.title: Solid start to AI camera trial with rock fisher rescue at one of NSW's deadliest locations
item.description: Surf Life Saving NSW says the successful rescue of a rock fisher at Kiama Blowhole using two AI-enabled surveillance cameras proves the technology works.

item.title: triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025 — when it happens, how to listen and more
item.description: Australia's favourite music poll is back for another year — here's when it happens and how to listen.

item.title: Former childcare worker sentenced to community service after pleading guilty to assaulting five-year-old
item.description: A former Queensland childcare worker who dunked a child in a "muddy" puddle, causing him to hit a toy and injure his face, has been sentenced to 100 hours of community service.

item.title: Wawrinka's post-match recovery beer and an 'elite coffee snob' — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Madison Keys praises Melbourne coffee, Stan Wawrinka says he deserves a beer and Nick Kyrgios back to racquet throwing ways. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Homeschool 'drop-off' groups are booming but some say they are unregulated
item.description: Education experts say homeschooling's exploding popularity has sparked a growing market of "drop-off" groups.

item.title: DNA found in an ancient Colombian skeleton may hold answers to origin of syphilis
item.description: A previously unknown strain of syphilis bacteria has been discovered in human remains in Colombia, dating back 5,500 years.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis lose first round Australian Open men's doubles clash
item.description: After playing like "shadows of our former selves", Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis are out of the Australian Open men's doubles and into an uncertain future.

item.title: ASX slightly up, Aussie dollar hits 15-month high — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market has finished slightly higher after a rally on Wall Street, as investors showed signs of relief a day after US President Donald Trump dropped tariff threats against eight European countries. Look back on our Friday business blog.

item.title: Inside the Syrian city of Raqqa, once known as Islamic State's 'Roundabout of Hell'
item.description: Syrian government forces have wrested back control of vast parts of its territory in recent weeks, as a new president moves to assert control over the war-torn country.

item.title: How cool rooms and cold storage work to keep fruit fresh year-round
item.description: Apples only grow for three months of the year — but thanks to an ancient technique, that doesn't stop us grabbing one from the grocery store year round.

item.title: Calls for state government to provide greater support for venue owners wanting to remove pokies
item.description: Mitch Crum thought removing pokies from his pub was a good thing, but the costly and confusing process made him feel like a criminal.

item.title: Water Corporation investigates private sector water supply for Port Hedland
item.description: Western Australia's Water Corporation is seeking private sector support to potentially truck water to Port Hedland, with supplies across the Pilbara under pressure.

item.title: Defiant Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' split, vows to remain leader
item.description: The Liberal leader did not speak about the Nationals' decision to terminate the Coalition on yesterday's National Day of Mourning, but on Friday insisted her focus was on the government.

item.title: Japan's demand for Australian table grapes drives export growth
item.description: A rise in demand is making it feasible for some Australian grapes to be on sale in South-East Asia within 48 hours of being dispatched.

item.title: Tropical low forecast to bring heavy rain to northern Cape York, Gulf of Carpentaria
item.description: Saturated catchments along the Gulf of Carpentaria and north-west Queensland are bracing for more heavy rain next week, although the weather bureau says the likelihood of a cyclone is low.

item.title: Oscar nominations 2026: All the snubs, successes and surprises
item.description: Hybrid horror Sinners came up as the big winner in the 98th Academy Award nominations, with Aussie actors also eyeing up gold, and Wicked: For Good wiped off the map.

item.title: De Minaur powers through with straight-sets win over Tiafoe
item.description: Alex de Minaur defeats American Frances Tiafoe in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena after Yulia Putintseva mocks Turkish fans after knocking out qualifier Zeynep Sönmez.

item.title: NBL star urges middle ground on Pride Round after Breakers jersey boycott
item.description: As the NBL's Pride Round begins, Marcus Lee warns an all-or-nothing approach could shut down the very conversations the round is meant to start.

item.title: Taylor Fritz pays tribute to 40-year-old Stan Wawrinka ahead of Australian Open match
item.description: It was meant as a compliment, rather than a show of disrespect, when Taylor Fritz answered a question about Australian Open rival Stan Wawrinka's age.

item.title: 1,000 cakes and eight complaints: Brisbane picnic event under investigation
item.description: An investigation has been launched into a viral Brisbane 'cake swap' event after attendees raised concerns over food safety and hygiene, with cakes reportedly left uncovered in hot weather for hours.

item.title: ICE officers detain five-year-old Minnesota boy as he arrives home from preschool
item.description: School officials and the family's lawyer say the boy and his father were taken to a detention facility in Texas, making the boy the fourth student from Minneapolis detained by immigration officers in recent weeks.

item.title: Fresh melioidosis infections spark warnings for North Queensland flood clean-up
item.description: Health authorities investigate a spike in case numbers for the soil-borne disease melioidosis over the past year as heavy rains again bring the bacteria to the surface.

item.title: Illegal dumping creates eyesore and hard work at Sunshine Coast op shops
item.description: Volunteers say they are tired of "lazy" residents dumping their unwanted goods outside op shops to avoid paying tip fees.

item.title: Paris Hilton brings sex tape story to Washington for AI deepfake porn fight
item.description: The party girl turned anti-abuse advocate throws her glamorous celebrity heft behind a push to tackle deepfake pornography.

item.title: Cyclone warning extended as tropical low edges closer to Kimberley coast
item.description: A tropical cyclone warning has been issued for residents along the far north WA coast.

item.title: Interstate police reviewing use of force in Kumanjayi White's death in custody in Alice Springs
item.description: After resisting calls for an arms-length investigation, NT police are "facilitating" prosecutors' request for an independent review of the arresting officers' use of force.

item.title: US and China sign off on TikTok agreement to avoid ban
item.description: Social media giant TikTok reaches a deal for a new joint venture in the United States to avoid being banned for American users. The platform's Beijing-based parent company, ByteDance, will retain a 19.9 per cent stake in the company.

item.title: What Bernard Fanning and Ben Lee's Hottest 100 topping hits tell us about them in 2005
item.description: In 2005, Bernard Fanning and Ben Lee were very different men with very similar struggles.

item.title: Donald Trump is obsessed with Greenland, but now his comments point to the 'entire Arctic'
item.description: After a week of escalating rhetoric over Greenland, Donald Trump says he has now secured "total access" to the Arctic island. This is why that region is so important.

item.title: Queensland brothers charged by Australian Federal Police
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Who is Indra Brown, the 15-year-old Melbourne schoolgirl going for gold at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: When 15-year-old Indra Brown reached the podium in her first World Cup event, she needed help from global superstar Eileen Gu to pop the cork on her champagne. She's had plenty more practice since, as she heads into the Milan Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games.

item.title: Letter sent to Lakemba Mosque threatening violence on Australia Day investigated by police
item.description: The note, seen by the ABC, incited violence against several groups, including Middle Eastern communities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and a number of political figures from Labor, the Greens and "socialists" were also singled out.

item.title: Trump sues JPMorgan Chase for $US5 billion, alleging bank closed accounts for 'political reasons'
item.description: Donald Trump is suing banking giant JPMorgan Chase and its chief executive for $US5 billion ($7.3 billion) over allegations that JPMorgan stopped providing banking services to him and his businesses for political reasons in January 2021.

item.title: US officials tout 'New Gaza' plans filled with shiny luxury skyscrapers
item.description: US officials have presented their vision for a "New Gaza" that would turn the shattered Palestinian territory into a glitzy resort of skyscrapers by the sea.

item.title: Track temperatures as heatwave sweeps across Australia
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: Launceston City Council staff to vote on four-day, full-pay work week
item.description: Launceston City Council and the Australian Services Union have reached in-principle agreement on a deal for employees to work 30.4 hours over four days, and be paid their full salaries.

item.title: Who is the Neo-Nazi who was booed at Hobart's March for Australia rally?
item.description: With the organisers of March for Australia rallies saying they "are in no way concerned by the presence" of members of the National Socialist Network, the ABC can confirm a Tasmanian man whose words were too extreme for many in the Hobart crowd is believed to be a leader within the state's Neo-Nazi movement.

item.title: Labor identity Tim Picton remembered at Perth Stadium memorial service
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among political figures and business leaders who travel across the country to pay their respects to Mr Picton.

item.title: Federal Court finds extended Victoria Police stop-and-search declaration was unlawful and invalid
item.description: The Federal Court has found a Victoria Police move to give officers greater powers in Melbourne's CBD for six months was invalid and unlawful.

item.title: What is a landslide, how do they happen and where are they most common?
item.description: Two people have died after a landslide hit their home in New Zealand and authorities are searching for several others feared dead in another slip nearby. Here's how landslides occur, the warning signs and where they are most common.

item.title: How to attract native wildlife and birds to your garden
item.description: There are simple things we can all do to encourage more native wildlife to our gardens, backyards, balconies and shared spaces.

item.title: Video of bull shark washed up on Brisbane River bank sparks debate over AI technology
item.description: A video posted to social media of a bull shark washed up in the Brisbane River went viral and prompted speculation that it was AI-generated, but experts say it appears to be legitimate.

item.title: Former Broome pub manager jailed for six years over rape of staff member
item.description: Stewart Patrick Burchell is jailed for six years, found guilty by jury trial of raping a staff member and indecently assaulting several others.

item.title: Sam Welsford wins Tour Down Under stage three, fears for riders with 42C temperatures Saturday
item.description: Sam Welsford claimed a brilliant Tour Down Under stage victory, the seventh of his career, as experts fear for riders ahead of 40-degree Celsius temperatures predicted for Saturday's fourth stage.

item.title: Bail accommodation facility for women opens in Alice Springs
item.description: There are hopes the Salvation Army-run facility will keep women safe and help them reintegrate into the community while easing pressure on the prison system.

item.title: Tasmania to introduce new gambling reforms, including mandatory facial recognition
item.description: The Tasmanian government has announced a suite of new harm minimisation measures to be implemented across hotels, clubs, and casinos, aiming to "reduce red tape and regulation".

item.title: Lake Cargelligo residents in shock after three people shot dead
item.description: Residents of a remote NSW town of just 1,500 residents have expressed shock at a deadly shooting spree where three people were shot dead.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Fatigue a concern as massive fires continue to burn across southern WA
item.description: DFES says there have been no confirmed property losses as the battle to contain fires near Boddington and Wandering continues.

item.title: Yulia Putintseva taunts Zeynep Sönmez's Australian Open supporters
item.description: Kazakhstan's Yulia Putintseva happily plays the role of villain following her three-set win over Zeynep Sönmez at the Australian Open.

item.title: Japanese PM Sanae Takaichi dissolves parliament after only three months in office, setting up snap election
item.description: Japan's prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, has dissolved the lower house of parliament, paving the way for a snap election on February 8.

item.title: To Lam wins second term to rule Vietnam through 2030
item.description: Vietnam's leader To Lam has been re-appointed as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years, and pledges to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

item.title: Lawyers call for Australian investigation into Israeli President Isaac Herzog amid genocide allegations
item.description: The Australian Centre for International Justice has formally requested a police investigation into Israel's president for alleged incitement to genocide. He is expected to visit to Australia next month.

item.title: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman charged with assault after Geraldton fracas
item.description: West Coast Eagles player Tyler Brockman is charged with causing grievous bodily harm following an incident in Geraldton in late December.

item.title: Fire threat means Tour Down Under stage four loses iconic Willunga Hill
item.description: Tomorrow's fourth stage of the Tour Down Under has been shortened due to local bushfire threats and forecast temperatures in excess of 40 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Remaining bodies found from Indonesia plane crash that lost contact mid-flight
item.description: Indonesian rescuers find the remaining bodies of 10 passengers on a fishery surveillance plane that went missing in Indonesia's South Sulawesi province at the weekend.

item.title: Dingoes unlikely to have caused death of Canadian backpacker Piper James on K'gari, coroner says
item.description: A preliminary report from the Coroners Court of Queensland finds dingo bites are not likely to have caused the death of Piper James on K'gari.

item.title: Steve Smith delivers again as Sixers down Hurricanes to cruise into BBL decider
item.description: Steve Smith top scores for the fifth time in as many innings as the Sixers down the Hurricanes to book a place in Sunday's BBL decider in Perth.

item.title: UK PM Keir Starmer demands Donald Trump apologise for 'appalling' claim NATO troops swerved frontline
item.description: Donald Trump criticised NATO during a Fox News interview on Thursday, saying the US had "never needed" the alliance.

item.title: Ukrainian, Russian and US officials meet for first trilateral talks to end war in Ukraine
item.description: The Abu Dhabi talks mark the first known trilateral meeting between the countries since Moscow launched its invasion of Ukraine more than four years ago.

item.title: Hottest 100 quiz: How well do you remember past countdowns?
item.description: While you wait to hear who is number one this year, test your memory of past Hottest 100 countdowns.

item.title: As Russia's war intensifies Europe is exploring military and economic independence
item.description: As the world's elite gathered in Davos, European leaders confronted a reality in which they might need to defend themselves, and potentially against, the United States.

item.title: From ultimatum to implosion: How the Coalition went its separate ways
item.description: Dissecting the implosion of the Coalition and figuring out what comes next has become a full-time vocation for the newly emancipated Liberals and Nationals.

item.title: US copied Iran's Shahed drones — now they are deployed in the Middle East
item.description: The US copied Iran's Shahed 136 drone. Now, as Donald Trump threatens military action against the regime, analysts say the US could soon use Iran's weapons technology against it.

item.title: Prince Harry takes on the Daily Mail in High Court privacy showdown
item.description: The Duke of Sussex takes on the publisher he believes poisoned his childhood, his marriage, and his peace of mind in a legal battle driven by anger as well as principle.

item.title: Search for Julian Ingram enters third day following Lake Cargelligo shooting
item.description: The search for a gunman accused of killing three people and seriously injuring another in New South Wales' Central West enters a third day.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Luana forms into category one system off Kimberley coast
item.description: Residents in WA's West Kimberley are being warned to prepare for days of wild weather, with a tropical cyclone forming up off the region's coast.

item.title: Alex de Minaur driven to prove doubters wrong as Australian Open campaign continues
item.description: Alex de Minaur is back in familiar territory, on the cusp of the Australian Open quarterfinals, but he is adamant he can make a deeper run at Melbourne Park than his previous appearances.

item.title: Australia smash Sri Lanka by nine wickets to stay unbeaten at Under-19s Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia have continued their dominant run through the Under-19s Cricket World Cup with Will Byrom's 5-14 leading the way in a nine-wicket win over Sri Lanka in their final group match.

item.title: Alex de Minaur's wedding confession and Yulia Putintseva plays the villain — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Alex de Minaur has some thoughts on his upcoming wedding with Katie Boulter, while Yulia Putintseva plays the villain on day six. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: Cyclone Luana tracker map: When will it hit Kimberley coast in WA?
item.description: Track the path of Tropical Cyclone Luana and monitor wind speeds as the system approaches the WA coast.

item.title: Crews prepare iconic landmarks in Wonnangatta Valley ahead of total fire ban
item.description: A number of historic landmarks across Victoria's east have been given protective cover in case a nearby bushfire breaks containment lines.

item.title: Australian Neo-Nazis use symbols that may evade hate speech laws
item.description: Viking symbols and a Norwegian jacket have now become synonymous with Australia's Neo-Nazi groups, but what do they mean?

item.title: Track temperatures as heatwave sweeps across continent over Australia Day weekend
item.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

item.title: Inside Minnesota, Reverend Ashley Horan is helping people steer clear of ICE agents
item.description: Reverend Ashley Horan lives one block from where Renee Good was shot and killed and by ICE agents. She and her neighbours have been tracking ICE's movements around Minneapolis.

item.title: Worst crown-of-thorns starfish outbreak in decades emerging on Great Barrier Reef
item.description: Scientists are rushing to contain an emerging outbreak of coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish on the Great Barrier Reef, warning it could be one of the worst in 60 years.

item.title: Anxious wait continues for families as New Zealand landslide search enters third day
item.description: Authorities have vowed to continue searching for those missing in the disaster, as officials announce an official review into the incident.

item.title: SA heatwave leads to total fire bans, catastrophic conditions and Tour Down Under changes
item.description: South Australia's hottest weather in six years creates dangerous bushfire conditions, which the head of the Country Fire Service says are "as serious as it gets".

item.title: Regional Victorian city of Bendigo facing future drinking water shortage
item.description: One regional city is 15 years from a shortfall of drinking water and some experts are calling for a trial to recycle wastewater into something drinkable.

item.title: Triggering a heatwave takes more than just temperature — as Australia braces for another
item.description: Yet another major heatwave is sweeping across south-eastern Australia. But what actually triggers the warning? Spoiler alert: hitting 40C is not enough.

item.title: Heatwave and fire warnings across south-east Australia as tropical cyclone hits WA
item.description: Parts of south-east Australia are bracing for severe heatwaves and fire warnings over the long weekend, as the Bureau of Meteorology issues a tropical cyclone warning for Western Australia.

item.title: Majority of NSW beaches shut amid shark attacks to reopen for Australia Day long weekend
item.description: Heatwave conditions and Australia Day long weekend activities are expected to draw crowds back to the water after a dangerous 48 hours on the New South Wales coast.

item.title: Ross River Virus cases quadruple in South Australia in 2025
item.description: There were more than four times the number of Ross River Virus cases in South Australia in 2025 compared to 2024, prompting a new public health awareness campaign.

item.title: Heatwave conditions forecast for southern Queensland over Australia Day long weekend
item.description: Severe heat wave conditions are predicted for most of the state's south, according to the Bureau of Meteorology, with temperatures in some areas expected to reach the mid-40s.

item.title: Zebrafish larvae helping researchers test for rare genetic disorders
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: How a tank of zebrafish helped two children born with a rare genetic variant
item.description: With a tank of zebrafish, Queensland researcher Jean Giacomotto was able to test a never-before seen genetic variant affecting two babies.

item.title: Police search for woman after man stabbed at North Wonthaggi, south-east of Melbourne
item.description: Police are searching for a woman after a man suffered serious injuries in a stabbing at North Wonthaggi in the early hours of Saturday morning.

item.title: Future of Canberra's Black Mountain Tower in limbo as Ngunnawal cultural site plans stall
item.description: Custodians say they have been excluded from talks between Telstra and the ACT government about plans to develop the iconic tower into a Ngunnawal cultural site.

item.title: Gen Z led the revolution in Bangladesh — can they win the election?
item.description: After toppling Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh's newest political party faces its first election next month, testing a newly formed alliance.

item.title: Calls to make financial literacy mandatory in schools amid concerns young people don't have basic financial knowledge
item.description: In an increasingly complex financial world of buy-now-pay-later schemes, scams, and social media marketing, there are renewed calls for financial literacy to become a mandatory part of the school curriculum.

item.title: Range Tennis Club in Toowoomba grows from 12 members to 600 in six years
item.description: A regional sports club bucks the national trend of declining membership in community sporting groups, serving up a love for the game of tennis that crosses generations.

item.title: Quick and easy pasta with a zesty, no-cook salsa sauce - ABC News
item.description: Salsa is not just for tacos. It's the perfect summer pasta sauce and makes the most of juicy summer tomatoes.

item.title: Chalamet getting fresh for an Oscar, or is his campaign a bit (ping) pongy?
item.description: Director Josh Safdie's debut solo film has been garnering accolades left and right but isn't quite lead actor Timothée Chalamet's finest work.
